data.title: CHARLES VIDOR SET TO PRODUCE 'SPQR'; Director Buys Screen Rights to Novel by Paul Bonner
data.meta_description: 20th Century Fox appeals $20,000 judgment awarded to R Lardner Jr in breach of contract suit against co
data.text:
CHARLES VIDOR SET TO PRODUCE 'SPQR'; Director Buys Screen Rights to Novel by Paul Bonner -Will Film It in Rome

CHARLES VIDOR SET TO PRODUCE 'SPQR'; Director Buys Screen Rights to Novel by Paul Bonner -Will Film It in Rome

May 29, 1952

See the article in its original context from

May 29, 1952 , Page 17Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

HOLLYWOOD, Calif., May 28 -- Charles Vidor, the director, has quietly latched onto the screen rights to the new novel, "SPQR," which is making its way up the best-seller list. The romantic adventure story is set in Rome in 1948 and was written by Paul Hyde Bonner. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
